Are you guilty of backseat moderating? Symptoms include:

- Use of the "Report Post" button
- Enforcement of forum rules
- Requesting users to change things in their posts
- Not being a real Moderator
- And many more!

I have been known to do a little from time to time. But not too often

Remember, kids: Everything in *moderation!*

Hi my name is Red and I'm a backseat moderator. I have been clean since January 9, 2015.

> 
> You're doing it for free as well then.

We all do it for free, moderator is not a paid position, it's a volunteer one. (Except for KasperVld, but he does a lot of other stuff, too.)

> 
> Scratch that last. We know who you are. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (Not really)
> .......

This part of your post is a mild violation of rule 2.2 d.

.......

Uh, well i gues i have problem with backseat moderating.

Well i have an infraction for it.

thanks RIC

> 
> Well i have an infraction for it.
> thanks RIC

I believe mentioning your infraction falls under rule 3.4, "Open discussion of staff decisions". I know that you are not supposed to discuss infractions and warnings because I have received a warning for posting a thread contesting an infraction I received. Oh drat, now I've gone and done it too. 

(I was being ironic, be gentle mods)
It is fine to say you got an infraction for something. That rule is about contesting or criticizing individual moderation actions publicly, which should instead be done via PM with a moderator.

I never did backseat moderation.

No report at all(\*), nothing.

Now, I frontseat moderate since february 11th.

 yes, I remember the date of my addition to the moderation team.(the cool thing is that I can use wolfram to know how much time I'm being a mod.(one month and 28 days so far(yes, I like to put several parenthesis in other parenthesis in the same sentence.(I don't think it's grammatically correct but I do it anyway)))).

(\*)well, apart one to request a close of one of my thread

Ah, well in that case I just need to come clean.

I've gotten many infractions and warnings for many somethings.

Edit: ok, I laughed at "frontseat moderate". caught me off guard ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I've been told off for backseat moderation as well.

Probably not an issue now, I think.

Look at these fancy guys, remembering when they became a real moderator. I haven't the foggiest smidgen of a clue what day it was when I got a PM asking me if I'd be alright being a moderator. I said yes, and about five minutes later I discovered some new forum functions to play with. About fifteen minutes after that I got my proper intro. But what date it was? Who knows. Long ago, in the mists of time.

But anyone who's been around long enough to know me before I was a moderator knows full well I walked the line of backseat moderation many a time before that.

I only reported once to remove a wildly off-topic post on a forum game. Actually it wasn't REALLY off-topic, it was just kinda weird and potentially offensive and I have no idea how that would work under the games context an- (stops rambling)

And another to get rid of another off-topic thread in the wrong forum (but it was removed before I hit "submit" ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) )

Oh, and another time to get mods to close a thread that had been requested to be clos- oh gawd I need help

In my defense, I *\*was\** a moderator on another forum once.. (not that I was awfully good at it)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-08T14:01:33Z" title="04/08/2015 02:01  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 8, 2015</time> by Norpo**

Let's see, I've:

- Reported Posts.
- I've requested users to change things in their threads.
- I've received an infraction for backseat moderation. (Later got reversed.)
- I often tell people their threads are in the wrong forum.

I'd say I'm guilty.

Two infractions on this forum for me so far.

![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)

Also, keeping with the title of the thread, I have never backseat moderated.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-08T14:14:47Z" title="04/08/2015 02:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 8, 2015</time> by RAINCRAFTER**

I've almost never have used the report button, but I've mentioned edgy threads to the mods a couple times.

My most rule-breaking era was right when I joined and had no idea how online forums even worked, since this was the first one I ever have been devoted to. I think a few of my threads were locked and others simply not taken too well. I've even gotten two rule infringements over the years, and trust me getting a letter from the mods is worse than failing a semester final. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Two infractions on this forum for me so far.

7 warnings and 7 infractions for me. my first was, incidentally, a warning for Backseat moderation. me saying "inb4 lock" was mis-interpreted as backseat moderation.

I do backseat moderation from time to time... Sometimes I feel the need to let the real moderators know when something's up that I see.

EDIT: I've received one infraction and one warning... Felt super guilty both times.
